newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian child sex inquiry enters decisive phase.
newsitem.headline: Belgian child sex inquiry enters decisive phase.

text.p: A Belgian parliamentary commission on Tuesday began the decisive phase of a probe into allegations that two convicted child abusers and suspected murders might have enjoyed high-level protection.

"I believe we are (investigating) a very delicate matter--the protection leads," commission member Dany Vandenbosche told BRTN television after the hearing with leading public prosecutor Michel Bourlet.

The commission is investigating the possibility that Marc Dutroux and Patrick Derochette -- between them accused of abusing and murdering five young girls -- and their accomplices may have escaped earlier detection due to well-placed friends.

On Tuesday, behind closed doors, the members of the all-party commission heard evidence from Bourlet, the public prosecutor leading the investigations into a series of missing children, and two top magistrates.
But, even as the commission resumes work, its task remains the subject of bitter controversy. Some critics say it is trying to over-reach it brief and others accusing it of underperforming.
In its preliminary report in April, the commission identified a degree of bungling by police and magistrates in investigations into a series of missing children that shocked the nation.

But it also said it could not rule out the possibility that incompetence might have been exacerbated by high-level efforts to divert the inquiries, and it would therefore resume its hearings into possible protection until the end of September.
On Tuesday the commissioners told Bourlet they wanted to find out if the bungled police investigations were due to incompetence, conspiracy or blackmail -- or a combination.

The scandal came to light in mid-August with the discovery of the bodies of two eight-year old girls at a house owned by Dutroux in the town of Sars-La-Buisierre near the central Belgian city of Charleroi.
Less than three weeks later the bodies of two more teenage girls were unearthed on a property in Charleroi linked to Dutroux, who has been charged with the murder of all four.
In February police discovered the body of another eight-year-old girl stuffed in a steel trunk in the basement of a garage in Brussels. They arrested and charged Derochette.
To date no link has been established between the two men.
